text: Hey dear community, Is it possible to create Smart Content based on UTM parameters ?
It is from a code perspective, not using the "smart content" options in the page editors though (last I checked)
you would just need to make your conditionals based on the request.query_dict.UTMPARAMETERhere
I would like to use the Smart Content tool in the Content Editor and add some rules
As you mentionned <@U25C65C3S> I could also code my own Smart Content Module in a code version with the NDM using request.query_dict.UTMPARAMETER , thatâ€™s it ?
NDM?
New Design Managern, sorry :disappointed:
Hey everyone. I'm attempting to put a custom module in my page template, but it never allows me to drop it. I try other modules and it works for them. Any idea why this is happening?

So, i've been trying to figure this out. We have the *Default File Manager Hosting Domain* set to a specific domain, however, when inserting images through an image module / the wysiwyg editor, it's defaulting the image src to the `<http://cdn2.HubSpot.net|cdn2.HubSpot.net>` root instead. Any ideas why this would be?
Not sure if related, but could it be because we're checking these against preview URLs / staged content through the *Content Staging* tool?

Hi All, as per my understanding, to make any section personalized, we will have to use Richtext module only. We can not make Image modules, custom modules, custom html module, single line text module etc personalized. Please let me know if my understanding is wrong and if there is a way to make above mentioned modules personalized.

As <@U25C65C3S> said above, you can code in different personalizations in a coded template, but the Smart Content tool is more limited to Rich Text and CTAs. 

You can read more about Smart Content here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/smart-content-user-guide/smart-content-frequently-asked-questions>

(Note: The article mentions custom HTML smart modules as well, but I'm not sure that's still possible in the new DM2)
Thanks <@U26BLKGE4> for your inputs. This is indeed very helpful
happy to help!

Is there a way we could set *async* and/or *defer* on the provided jquery <script> tag from HubSpot? If not, cause I know it's loaded from the `{{ standard_header_includes }}` required tag, that's fine.
Just looking to get rid of the "eliminate render blocking javascsript" that always comes up in page speed insights regarding that file.
As of right now, not that I know of, but I know those page speed insights errors are something HS is aware of and working on.
Glad to know they're working on those, thanks!
We are rolling out functionality to give the option to move jQuery to the footer so this is no longer an issue
Good to know, thanks!
any way to copy a date on a deal to contact record?
